text.section: There is an Energy Overcharge Restitution Fund.

section.section: The Fund is a continuing, nonlapsing fund that is not subject to the provisions of § 7-302 of this subtitle.

There shall be credited to the Fund:
all federal fund revenues consisting of refunds received by the State from any source as a direct or indirect result of litigation or administrative proceedings prosecuted by the U.S. Department of Energy to redress violations of federal petroleum pricing regulations under the Emergency Petroleum Allocation Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 751 through 756, and the Energy Policy and Conservation Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 757 through 760H; and
all special fund revenues received and accepted as a gift under § 2-201 of this article that are expressly given for the purpose of energy assistance or weatherization for individuals in this State.
Revenues received by the State as a result of claims representing purchases by the State are excluded from the Fund.

text.section:
The Treasurer shall:
invest and reinvest the Fund in the same manner as other State funds; and
credit any investment earnings to the Fund.

Expenditures from the Fund shall be made by:
an appropriation in the annual State budget; or
a budget amendment in accordance with § 7-209 of this title, provided that any budget amendment shall be submitted to and approved by the Legislative Policy Committee prior to the expenditure or obligation of funds.

section.section:
The Fund shall be expended subject to any restrictions on its use or other limitations on its allocation that are:
expressly provided by statute; or
required as a condition of the acceptance of funds.
In addition to the provisions of paragraph (2) of this subsection, priority shall be given to the energy assistance and weatherization programs.

Disbursements from the Fund to programs funded by the State or with federal funds administered by the State shall be used solely to supplement, and not to supplant, funds otherwise available for such programs under federal or State law.
